content: there will be a little hole in the top part of the ear at this point use your long tail and sew it up a little bit to get rid of the hole you re done make sure you stuff all the parts to your liking and use one of the long tails you ve left and sew them up for the head and neck sew the open sides together for the legs and arms sew the open ends this is what will attach to the body closed with a whip stitch after you stuff them more visual aids which are obviously not a bunny and the wacky colors are to make things more visible line up your body parts open ends thread your needle and bring it front to back through both together and pin them in place loops on the neck pull it tightly through same thing with the head insert needle and there you go do that through each back to front through both loops pull stitch all the way around sssseeeewwwwiiiinnnngggg ttttiiiippppssss use straight pins to line up the stitches as much as possible when sewing the head/body seams make sure that you go through both loops on each body part for each stitch practice makes perfect i ve tried pretty much every resource to find the right technique for me believe me i ve come a long way and you will too if you re just starting out face tips put eyes in first don t put the backs on until you re sure that they re even use the eyes to help center the nose and mouth try a few different facial expressions if you re not sure you can pull them out so it s not the end of the world if your bunny looks deranged for a little while ^_^ ooootttthhhheeeerrrr aaaammmmiiiigggguuuurrrruuuummmmiiii ttttiiiippppssss steer clear of any yarn with a sheen to it it s not forgiving at all cheap acrylic yarn is best for beginners throw your metal hook away it will create more pain for you than joy go bamboo i love my clover hook you ll thank me later thank you for trying my pattern i ve used it a few times but if you have any difficulty please don t hesitate to email me bonamimld@gmail com and when you re done with your bunny please send me a picture of the finished fellow i love to see other people s spin on my patterns <3 melissa lynn bonami etsy com and of course all products made from
